content:
Greetings, dear guests, and welcome to you all. Tonight, each of you shall take part in a wonderful game where the winners shall all receive a prize of untold riches! Each of you gathered here has received, along with your invitations, the role in which you shall play in this dinner mystery performance! Rest assured, all expenses have been taken care of by our gracious host, so please, relax, and enjoy your stay here while the game is in session!

Further instructions have been provided for you to follow, and you will be wise to look them over and abide by them during the course of this game.

1) General Rules
1a. This is a game, and sportsmanlike conduct is expected. I will not tolerate personal attacks. This is your only warning.
1b. I am the moderator of this game, and as such, I will decide what to do in any given situation.
1c. That said I am not infallible. If there are ever any error(s) you notice, please contact me via PM with the error(s) and I will see to it they will be dealt with.
1d. I also reserve the right to amend or add onto the rules if the need for so arises. Any changes that may/may not be made will be made public when they occur.
1e. This is my font type; as such, using it is against the rules.
1f. If you wish to address the game mod during play, you may either PM me or post in the thread; if you post in thread your post must be bolded, and start with "@MOD:" or I may miss it.
1g. I reserve the right to force-replace a player at my own digression, and if I am required to mod-kill a player, their role shall be changed to "Neutral-Survivor," and they shall lose the game.
1h. In the event of a mod-kill, the game shall proceed automatically to the next game phase.

2) Activity and Gameplay
2a. Posting and participating in the game is required of all players not on V/LA. If you forsee being unable to post please post in-game of this, and if you must leave the game please PM me with a replacement request.
2b. A person who is not on V/LA and has not posted within 3 days of their latest post shall be prodded by me.
2c. If a player does not respond to a prod within 4 days of being prodded, they will be forcibly replaced.
2d. I will only prod each player twice. On the third required prodding, the player shall instead be forcibly replaced.
2e. Unless otherwise stated in your role PM, you are NOT allowed to privately communicate with other players outside of the game thread.
2f. DO NOT quote any discussions you may have with the moderator of the game, whether in text or picture format. Doing so will result in a mod-kill and your role being changed to "neutral-survivor" and forfeiting the game.
2g. Encrypted, invisible, or small/hard to read text is NOT allowed.

3) Voting
3a. All votes that are to be counted towards official vote counts must be in bold. You may also use the vote tags as well.
3b. Moderator vote counts will be posted as soon as possible.
3c. If you would like an official vote count, you may also post in the thread requesting one by typing "@MOD: Vote count please," or any clear derivatives of that.
3d. Unvoting is not required, but highly appreciated. To unvote, you may post in bold "Unvote," or use the unvote tags.
3e. A lynch will occur when there are a majority of players voting for a person to be lynched. If no majority is reached by deadline, then no-lynch will occur.
3f. No-Lynch is an acceptable vote as well.

4) Deadlines
4a. Each day phase shall last 3 weeks, and each night shall last 4 days.
4b.Extensions to each may be granted if need be.
4c. Any night action not received before deadline will be counted as a no-action. If you have an ability and wish to not act, please PM me with your decision.

At least one person has received the following role:
Spoiler: Sample VT Role PM
Now, at least one player has been given the following role for this game:

Hello, and greetings [username]! You are an Innocent Townie.
-You do not have any night actions.
-During the day, you may use your voice and votes to try and track down scum and win the game!
-You are town-aligned, and win with the town.[/quote
-Please PM me your role name, and any abilities you may have to confirm.



~~~~
Greetings.
The game has begun!

This space will now be used for any general statements that need to be made by yours truly.
Do note I am currently busy with school affairs, and as a general warning wednesdays I may not have as much access as other days of the week.


~~~~

As the ruler of a vast and varied empire we know that it can be hard to understand the customs of others sometimes, but this must not distract us from our goal. Some here are ponies, some are not, but most of us are town and the law of averages suggests that each of these camps is likely to have at least on traitor in it. I don't want to be a wet blanket, and since a sizable minority (or maybe even a majority, I haven't counted) of players in this game seem intent on talking about ponies, I won't demand that everyone stop, but I'm not interested in spending the next month or two reading a bunch of magical pony talk. That being said.

Whiskers, I appreciate that you have made some substantive contributions to the game, but I resent having to sift through a load of pony crap to get to it. I also resent that this is what I'm spending my time thinking and talking about rather than digging for scum tells. My problem with the pony speak and role playing isn't that I hate My Little Pony or role playing (I've got a shelf full of D&D books). It's that indulging in pony speak and role playing is very clearly resulting in less clarity and concision in certain players' posts, which hurts the town, period. It makes it harder to find scum tells, it makes it harder to analyze points, and it's distracting. I understand that you all are having fun with it, and I don't have a problem with that necessarily, but it's not what I signed up for when I signed up for a mini-normal game, which are explicitly unthemed. I'm a little different than most players on this site in that I only play in one game at a time, and I try my best to be committed and focused on that game. I'm not sure I want this to be the one game I play for the next few months. At the same time, I don't want to spoil the fun of the half dozen or so of you who enjoy talking like cartoon ponies. You're entitled to play the game how you want, although I'd suggest that you might have been better off setting up a theme game if that's the kind of game you were looking for.

So the bottom line is, I'm not digging the pony talk, but I don't want to be the guy that poops on your pony talk party, so I don't feel like I can ask you to stop. I'm considering allowing a few RL days to pass and see if I get used to the pony speak, but based on how much it is irritating me atm and how counterproductive I think it is, I think that's pretty unlikely. Sorry to keep bitching about it, but there it is. I'll try my best to be productive from here on out until I decide that I just can't be productive in this kind of environment.

Well ladies and gentlemen, I do hope you're all enjoying the festivities this evening. There is plenty to do here at this masquerade ball. (Several hours later)

"Ahhh!" A shout rang out from up the stairs.
As everyone rushed up the stairs to see what caused the commotion, the doors to the dining hall were thrown wide open.
"He's dead, amateur is dead!" cried out a startled guest.
As everyone filed into the room, theamateur's body laid on top of the long oak table, a knife sticking out of his chest. A note was left lying beside

(Cont. From last post)
beside his head. Scribbled out in sloppy handwriting, was a note from the murderer.

"You pompous socialites think you have the right to fatten yourselves, drink yourself mad, and dance the night away? We came here for your riches, but we will leave with your lives!"

There were several people standing beside the table, staring at the body. The host, wearing an elaborate costume, asked them what transpired. All together they looked at the body. Albert, panting and out of breath, looked up.

"There was an argument, we were all arguing about rumors of there being a group of theives here, and we started accusing each other of being one of them. Amateur, he started getting loud, then he stormed out. We had all thought the way he reacted, we thought he was one of them!"

GLaDOS, Whiskers, and everyone around nodded.

The host walked over and picked up the note. He looked down at the corpse, then lowered his head and sighed.

"Well, what's done is done. While your intentions were just, you have ended the life of this innocent townsperson. it is a shame to see him go in such a manner, but, there can be no undoing the past.

But please, it is late. Everyone, pleasr return to your rooms. I will look into this matter more deeply over the night." With that, everyone returned to their rooms, worried for their lives. But, there was still more festivities to be had tomorrow morning.

The night was a restless one for all the guests in attendance. After hearing the debacle over the intruders, all of the guests attending were restless. Throughout the night, several guests could be found resting in the lobby, too uneasy to sleep in their own rooms. Several guests would even go into the rooms of other guests, hoping that the company of another would bring them solstice and comfort through the night.

The host, resting in his private rooms, contemplated the events that had transpired over the course of the day. This affair had brought a great deal of stress on him, and he was worried that soon his own guests would turn against one another from the threats made by the mysterious group of burglars. But, such a minor threat would not be able to best him, so he began to contemplate what events should be held for the following day..

As the sun rose, and daylight crept in through the windows, the guests all gathered in the large dining hall for the morning buffet. The host stood at the head of the table, and prepared a toast for everyone.

“I trust everyone has slept well? I have planned many a great event for this morning, and many more surprises for the rest of the day. Now, is everyone here? I have an announcement to make.”

A voice chimed out from the crowd

“Albert and subgenius are not here sir.”

“Well, can someone please go to their rooms and wake them? This is something everyone should hear,” said the host. One of the maids and several guests left the dining hall.

A few minutes passed as the host addressed the guests, warning them not to let the threatening letter discourage them from enjoying their time at the estate. He assured them that the matter would be handled properly, and that no further harm would come to his guests. As he was coming to the conclusion of his speech, a man came running in through the door. Beads of sweat were running down his face, and he was out of breath.
“They’re dead, they’re both dead!” he cried out. The room fell silent..

===
Flavor:
===

The guests were in an uproar for the remainder of the day. All of them tried to enjoy themselves, but lurking in the back of everyone’s minds, the thought of the murders lingered. After the police came through and gathered testimonies from everyone, they assured them that the situation would be taken care of, and to put it out of their minds.

The host, however, was uneasy. The entire day’s plans were starting to fall apart. The performers he originally hired to act out a Shakespearean play had almost refused to put on their play before he offered to triple their pay. The afternoon circus wasn’t faring any better, as the ringmaster was refusing to perform without having his own payment increased as well.

All the stress started to wear on the host. However, he still had confidence in his guests to maintain composure and that tonight, dinner would go without any incidents. At the same time, he couldn’t help but feel a foreboding sense of terror..

“Ladies and gentlemen, I welcome you once again to dinner this evening,” he started with. “A fine assortment of foods and drinks have been prepared for all of you to enjoy, graciously provided for you tonight free of charge, as you all deserve nothing less!”

A quiet applause rippled throughout the room. It lasted for a few seconds, but soon all but faded away. However, in the back of the room, one person leaning against the wall continued clap slowly, more slow than everyone had before.

“You’re full of it, old man,” the figure started. “You know just as well as I do that you’re terrified for your life here.”

“How dare you insult the host?!” cried out a voice sitting at the table. “Tarson, you had better explain yourself!” The room became full with chatter.

“Oh, I will,” he started, with a grin on his face. “This old fool? he’s terrified. He’s just putting up a show for you, so you don’t realize we’re all doomed!”

Maxwell stood up from the table, walked over to tarson, then punched him across the face. Tarson stumbled backwards, then returned with a punch of his own. The rest of the guests rushed to pull the two apart. All the while the host stood at the end of the table awestruck.

Struggling to get free, Tarson continued to try to punch and kick and bite his way free, shouting obscenities all the while. During the commotion, a slip of paper fell out from his waistcoat pocket. One of the female guests reached down to pick up the paper, then shouted when she finished reading it.

“What is it?” asked Charlie.

“The note, it says that he’s going to kill someone else tonight!” Everyone froze and stared at tarson. He flailed his arms and broke free, then turned and pulled out a gun and waved it around. He swung it around, moving from person to person, spinning in place.

“Stay back,” he yelled, “or I’ll start shooting!” His expression was panicked, his hands were shaking, and he was laughing uncontrollably. “Stay away from me!”

Bang.

Tarson fell to the ground, a red hole appearing in his chest. The host stood at the end of the room, a pistol gripped tightly in his hands.. He started to crawl away, but Charlie reached down and grabbed Tarson’s pistol.

He fired another round into tarson’s head, and he was dead.

Alright ladies and gents, game's back on!

The guests rested well that night, knowing that one of the intruders now lay dead. The host, after the meal, alerted the authorities to the incident. The body was loaded into an ambulance, statements were taken, and soon after everyone went to bed.

Again, the host contemplated in his study, pondering the next day’s events. After the incident the night before, the magician he had originally hired to perform refused to put on his show, and left soon after midnight. The host was not worried, for he had several other avenues of entertainment lined up, but for tonight, he wanted to rest easy. While one of the intruders was found and killed, there were still more. He could not be sure how many remained, but progress was progress.

In the bar, several guests could be seen, conversing with one another. The band playing was performing a slow jazz tune. Other guests were in their rooms, or in the rooms of other guests, amusing themselves in various forms of entertainment..


The next morning, the host walked down to the bar to meet with his bartender, find out how things went the night before. He said everything was going well, but that there was a stench coming from the bathroom.

As he walked to the bathroom door, scotch in hand, the smell grew more and more noticeable, until it became almost unbearable. He knocked on the door, but as he did it swung open. Inside, the body of Maxwell could be found lying in a pool of blood on the floor. A notepad and pen were clenched in each of his hands, with a broken cell phone at his feet.

The host stumbled backwards, and looked to the bartender. He told him to alert the authorities, but the bartender looked back at him with a grimace. The host knew immediately what was wrong.

Several guests stormed into the room, some still wearing pajamas. Their faces showed expressions of surprise, fear, and sorrow.

“Sir, monk was found dead in his room!” cried out one of the maids. The host stumbled to his feet, then calmly walked over to the bar.

“Get me the police, and another scotch,” he said with a heavy tone. His composure started to falter…
